archdesc.scopecontent: Tells how skiing and ski jumping in Michigan's northern lower peninsula and Upper Peninsula evolved from local club sports to a major winter industry. Examines how winter sports parks and carnivals were created to attract tourists. Topics covered include ski jumping at Ishpeming and Iron Mountain, the Michigan Technological University winter carnival and ski team, the Bietila brothers of Ishpeming, and the development of the Boyne Mountain ski resort by Everett Kirchner.
